intro: Psychotria naviculiformis, commonly known as the "boat-shaped Psychotria," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, boat-shaped leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, clustered white or pink flowers that are typically visited by various pollinators. Psychotria naviculiformis is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth areas.
